snippet: Drug-injecting addicts who took an antiretroviral pill were half as likely to become infected with H.I.V. as those who did not, completing a body of evidence that such treatments can prevent AIDS in every group at risk.
abstract: Major study published in journal The Lancet finds that drug-injecting addicts who took daily antiretroviral pill were half as likely to become infected with HIV as those who did not; findings provide final piece of evidence that such treatments can prevent AIDS in every group at risk.
lead_paragraph: Drug-injecting addicts who took an antiretroviral pill were half as likely to become infected with H.I.V. as those who did not, completing a body of evidence that such treatments can prevent AIDS in every group at risk.

headline.main: Study Shows Pill Prevents H.I.V. Among Drug Addicts
headline.print_headline: Study of Drug Users Affirms Pill Prevents H.I.V. in All Risk Groups
